result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. CLAYTON E THUNDER

records.addlTxt:
9:46 AM Defendant CLAYTON E THUNDER in court.  Attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant wants to waive his right to an attoney for right now because he has been waiting for months.  Judge reviews all cases and all charges and the maximum penalties facing the defendant.  Defendant is unsure if he can represent himself; therefore Judge is not able to allow him to waive his right to an attorney at this time.
Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Eligible for SPD Services

Public defender office still looking for counsel.  Defendant wants to represent himself.  Court sets new date for attorney waiver review.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant waives the time limits for holding the PH. Court accepts waiver.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No contact with AW 11-16-79, or her residence or place of employment.  Stay at least 1,000 feet from AW at all times.    No entry into any Class B licensed establishments.  Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription.  No contact with known drug users or dealers.  No travel outside the state without prior court approval.

01:20 PM Defendant CLAYTON E THUNDER in court with attorney Matthew Kolell.  Defendant CLAYTON E THUNDER in custody via zoom.  Joseph J. Kaupie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does qualify, unsure who will represent.  
State is requesting $10,000 cash bond.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
